Mo(u)rning (re)reading

The New Nihilism - Peter Lamborn Wilson [2018]

[In the museum] â€˜everyone wore headphones that told them what to think and when to move on, and the silence was sepulchral. Culture itself, it seems, is a form of mourningâ€™

Peter Lamborn Wilson (aka Hakim Bey) left us dozens of books of pointed commentary on (the flaws of) modern culture. Some of his ideas, infused with anarchism and hermetic philosophy seem more pertinent today than they ever were. ðŸ‘Š
